articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Donald Trump will be sworn in today, ushering in another turbulent four-year term with promises to push the limits of executive power, deport millions of immigrants, secure retribution against his political enemies and transform the role of the US on the world stage.
articles.title: Triumphant Trump returns to White House, launching new era of upheaval

articles.author: James Oliphant
articles.description: In his inaugural address, President Donald Trump promised a new golden age, casting himself as a uniter. But for a speech that heralded a bright future, it often echoed the past.
articles.title: A new American era is ushered in by a familiar Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: By Hatem Khaled, Mohammed Salem and Nidal al-Mughrabi
articles.title: Palestinian rescue workers begin search for people under rubble on day two of ceasefire

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Nearly 1,660 Afghans cleared by the U.S. government to resettle in the U.S., including family members of active duty U.S. military personnel, are having their flights canceled under President Donald Trump's order suspending U.S. refugee programs, a U.S. official and a leading refugee resettlement advocate said on Monday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump administration canceling flights for nearly 1,660 Afghan refugees, say U.S official, advocate

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is due to attend on Tuesday a Constitutional Court hearing of his impeachment trial where the detained leader may get a chance to argue his case or answer questions over his short-lived bid to impose martial law.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon to attend impeachment trial for the first time

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Luc Cohen
articles.description: President Donald Trump faces an arduous task delivering on his Inauguration Day promise of a "Golden Age of America" in the face of a closely split Congress, inevitable lawsuits and recalcitrant world leaders.
articles.title: Trump faces stiff challenges delivering on his promised 'Golden Age'

articles.author: Kenneth Li
articles.description: The app and website were operational on Monday, but TikTok was still not available for download in the Apple and Google app stores, suggesting the two companies were waiting for clearer legal assurances.
articles.title: TikTok awaits Trump reprieve as China signals it is open to a deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's defence ministry said on Tuesday the denuclearisation of North Korea must continue to be the goal necessary for lasting global peace, after reports that U.S. President Donald Trump had called Pyongyang "a nuclear power."
articles.title: South Korea says denuclearising North Korea still goal after reports Trump called it nuclear power

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Malaysia's attorney-general's chambers has sought a gag order to ban public discussion of former Prime Minister Najib Razak's judicial review claim that a document exists allowing him to serve his remaining prison sentence under house arrest, according to state news agency Bernama.
articles.title: Malaysia seeks gag order on talk of jailed ex-PM Najib's bid to reveal royal document

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: As Donald Trump's second term as U.S. president dawns, Ukrainian soldiers and civilians see a hard road ahead in their war with Russia, and many have come to hope for a ceasefire without expelling Russian forces.
articles.title: As Trump era begins, Ukrainians are exhausted by war
